001package com.technototes.library.control;
002
003import com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.Gamepad;
004import com.technototes.library.general.Enablable;
005import com.technototes.library.general.Periodic;
006import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
007import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
008import java.util.function.DoubleSupplier;
009
010/**
011 * A class to extend gamepads from, it does the internal processing for you.
012 *
013 * @param <T> The class for the button components on the gamepad
014 * @param <U> The class for the axis components on the gamepad
015 * @author Alex Stedman
016 */
017public class GamepadBase<T extends ButtonBase, U extends AxisBase>
018    implements Periodic, Enablable<GamepadBase<T, U>> {
019
020    private boolean enabled = true;
021    // normal gamepad
022    private Gamepad gamepad;
023    /**
024     * The button objects for the XBox game controller
025     */
026    public T a, b, x, y, start, back;
027    /**
028     * The button objects for the PS4 game controller
029     */
030    public T cross, circle, square, triangle, share, options;
031    /**
032     * The button objects for both the XBox and PS4 controllers
033     */
034    public T leftBumper, rightBumper, dpadUp, dpadDown, dpadLeft, dpadRight, leftStickButton, rightStickButton;
035    /**
036     * The axis objects
037     */
038    public U leftTrigger, rightTrigger, leftStickX, leftStickY, rightStickX, rightStickY;
039    /**
040     * The stick objects
041     */
042    public GamepadStick<U, T> leftStick, rightStick;
043    /**
044     * The dpad object
045     */
046    public GamepadDpad<T> dpad;
047
048    // periodics to run
049    private Periodic[] periodics;
050    private Enablable<?>[] enablables;
051
052    private Class<T> buttonClass;
053    private Class<U> axisClass;
054
055    /**
056     * Creates a gamepad with these parameters
057     *
058     * @param g      The gamepad to base around
059     * @param bClass The class object passed for the button components (Should be the same as the one used for the class parameter T)
060     * @param aClass The class object passed for the axis components (Should be the same as the one used for the class parameter U)
061     */
062    public GamepadBase(Gamepad g, Class<T> bClass, Class<U> aClass) {
063        gamepad = g;
064        buttonClass = bClass;
065        axisClass = aClass;
066        try {
067            setComponents(g);
068        } catch (Exception e) {
069            e.printStackTrace();
070        }
071
072        leftStick = new GamepadStick<>(leftStickX, leftStickY, leftStickButton);
073        rightStick = new GamepadStick<>(rightStickX, rightStickY, rightStickButton);
074        dpad = new GamepadDpad<>(dpadUp, dpadDown, dpadLeft, dpadRight);
075        periodics =
076            new Periodic[] {
077                a,
078                b,
079                x,
080                y,
081                start,
082                back,
083                leftBumper,
084                rightBumper,
085                leftTrigger,
086                rightTrigger,
087                leftStick,
088                rightStick,
089                dpad,
090            };
091        enablables =
092            new Enablable[] {
093                a,
094                b,
095                x,
096                y,
097                start,
098                back,
099                leftBumper,
100                rightBumper,
101                leftTrigger,
102                rightTrigger,
103                leftStick,
104                rightStick,
105                dpad,
106            };
107    }
108
109    // to actually instantiate the objects
110    private void setComponents(Gamepad g)
111        throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException {
112        // buttons
113        // a=new T();
114        a = buttonInstance(() -> g.a);
115        b = buttonInstance(() -> g.b);
116        x = buttonInstance(() -> g.x);
117        y = buttonInstance(() -> g.y);
118        cross = a;
119        circle = b;
120        square = x;
121        triangle = y;
122
123        start = buttonInstance(() -> g.start);
124        back = buttonInstance(() -> g.back);
125        share = back;
126        options = start;
127
128        // bumpers
129        leftBumper = buttonInstance(() -> g.left_bumper);
130        rightBumper = buttonInstance(() -> g.right_bumper);
131
132        // dpad
133        dpadUp = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_up);
134        dpadDown = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_down);
135        dpadLeft = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_left);
136        dpadRight = buttonInstance(() -> g.dpad_right);
137
138        // left stick
139        leftStickX = axisInstance(() -> g.left_stick_x);
140        leftStickY = axisInstance(() -> g.left_stick_y);
141        leftStickButton = buttonInstance(() -> g.left_stick_button);
142
143        // right stick
144        rightStickX = axisInstance(() -> g.right_stick_x);
145        rightStickY = axisInstance(() -> g.right_stick_y);
146        rightStickButton = buttonInstance(() -> g.right_stick_button);
147
148        // triggers
149        leftTrigger = axisInstance(() -> g.left_trigger);
150        rightTrigger = axisInstance(() -> g.right_trigger);
151    }
152
153    // enums
154
155    /**
156     * Button enum for all buttons on gamepad
157     */
158    public enum Button {
159        /**
160         * XBox A button
161         */
162        A,
163        /**
164         * XBox B button
165         */
166        B,
167        /**
168         * XBox X button
169         */
170        X,
171        /**
172         * XBox Y button
173         */
174        Y,
175        /**
176         * PS4 Cross (X) button
177         */
178        CROSS,
179        /**
180         * PS4 Circle (O) button
181         */
182        CIRCLE,
183        /**
184         * PS4 Square button
185         */
186        SQUARE,
187        /**
188         * PS4 Triangle button
189         */
190        TRIANGLE,
191        /**
192         * PS4 Share button
193         */
194        SHARE,
195        /**
196         * PS4 Options button
197         */
198        OPTIONS,
199        /**
200         * PS4/XBox Start button
201         */
202        START,
203        /**
204         * PS4/XBox Back button
205         */
206        BACK,
207        /**
208         * Left bumper button
209         */
210        LEFT_BUMPER,
211        /**
212         * Right bumper button
213         */
214        RIGHT_BUMPER,
215        /**
216         * Button when clicking the left stick
217         */
218        LEFT_STICK_BUTTON,
219        /**
220         * Button which clicking the right stick
221         */
222        RIGHT_STICK_BUTTON,
223    }
224
225    /**
226     * Axis enum for all axis on gamepad
227     */
228    public enum Axis {
229        /**
230         * Left stick's horizontal axis
231         */
232        LEFT_STICK_X,
233        /**
234         * Left stick's vertical axis
235         */
236        LEFT_STICK_Y,
237        /**
238         * Right stick's horizontal axis
239         */
240        RIGHT_STICK_X,
241        /**
242         * Right stick's vertical axis
243         */
244        RIGHT_STICK_Y,
245        /**
246         * Left Trigger's axis
247         */
248        LEFT_TRIGGER,
249        /**
250         * Right Trigger's axis
251         */
252        RIGHT_TRIGGER,
253    }
254
255    /**
256     * Returns a button
257     *
258     * @param bu The enum to choose which gamepad button to return
259     * @return The gamepad button that you choose with the enum
260     */
261    public T getButton(Button bu) {
262        switch (bu) {
263            case A:
264                return a;
265            case B:
266                return b;
267            case X:
268                return x;
269            case Y:
270                return y;
271            case CROSS:
272                return cross;
273            case CIRCLE:
274                return circle;
275            case SQUARE:
276                return square;
277            case TRIANGLE:
278                return triangle;
279            case SHARE:
280                return share;
281            case OPTIONS:
282                return options;
283            case BACK:
284                return back;
285            case START:
286                return start;
287            case LEFT_BUMPER:
288                return leftBumper;
289            case RIGHT_BUMPER:
290                return rightBumper;
291            case LEFT_STICK_BUTTON:
292                return leftStickButton;
293            case RIGHT_STICK_BUTTON:
294                return rightStickButton;
295            default:
296                return null;
297        }
298    }
299
300    /**
301     * Returns an axis
302     *
303     * @param as The enum for the axis that is wanted to be returned
304     * @return The chosen axis
305     */
306    public U getAxis(Axis as) {
307        switch (as) {
308            case LEFT_STICK_X:
309                return leftStickX;
310            case LEFT_STICK_Y:
311                return leftStickY;
312            case RIGHT_STICK_X:
313                return rightStickX;
314            case RIGHT_STICK_Y:
315                return rightStickY;
316            case LEFT_TRIGGER:
317                return leftTrigger;
318            case RIGHT_TRIGGER:
319                return rightTrigger;
320            default:
321                return null;
322        }
323    }
324
325    /**
326     * Returns a button as boolean (same as isPressed)
327     *
328     * @param bu The enum to specify which button to get as boolean
329     * @return The chosen button as boolean
330     */
331    public boolean getButtonAsBoolean(Button bu) {
332        return getButton(bu).getAsBoolean();
333    }
334
335    /**
336     * Returns an axis as double
337     *
338     * @param as The enum to specify which axis to get as double
339     * @return The chosen axis as double
340     */
341    public double getAxisAsDouble(Axis as) {
342        return getAxis(as).getAsDouble();
343    }
344
345    /**
346     * Returns an axis as boolean
347     *
348     * @param as The enum to specify which axis to get as boolean
349     * @return The chosen axis as boolean
350     */
351    public boolean getAxisAsBoolean(Axis as) {
352        return getAxis(as).getAsBoolean();
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * Returns the left stick
357     *
358     * @return The left stick on the gamepad
359     */
360    public GamepadStick<U, T> getLeftStick() {
361        return leftStick;
362    }
363
364    /**
365     * Returns the right stick
366     *
367     * @return The right stick on the gamepad
368     */
369    public GamepadStick<U, T> getRightStick() {
370        return rightStick;
371    }
372
373    /**
374     * Returns the Dpad object
375     *
376     * @return The dpad
377     */
378    public GamepadDpad<T> getDpad() {
379        return dpad;
380    }
381
382    /**
383     * Run the periodic functions for the controller (if the controller is enabled)
384     */
385    @Override
386    public void periodic() {
387        if (isDisabled()) {
388            return;
389        }
390        for (Periodic p : periodics) {
391            p.periodic();
392        }
393    }
394
395    /**
396     * Returns the encapsulated gamepad
397     *
398     * @return The gamepad
399     */
400    public Gamepad getGamepad() {
401        return gamepad;
402    }
403
404    /**
405     * Great a ButtonBase type from the given BooleanSupplier
406     *
407     * @param b the function to wrap in a ButtonBase
408     * @return the T (extends ButtonBase) which the ButtonBase will wrap
409     * @throws InstantiationException    Couldn't create the target type
410     * @throws IllegalAccessException    Couldn't access the constructor
411     * @throws NoSuchMethodException     Couldn't find a constructor with a BooleanSupplier parameter
412     * @throws InvocationTargetException Couldn't invoke the constructor for other reasons
413     */
414    public T buttonInstance(BooleanSupplier b)
415        throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException {
416        return buttonClass.getConstructor(BooleanSupplier.class).newInstance(b);
417    }
418
419    /**
420     * Returns the U (extended from AxisBase) type wrapped around a simple DoubleSupplier
421     *
422     * @param d The function to call
423     * @return A U (of AxisBase type) that's wrapped around the DoubleSupplier d provided
424     * @throws InstantiationException    Couldn't create the target type
425     * @throws IllegalAccessException    Couldn't access the constructor
426     * @throws NoSuchMethodException     Couldn't find a constructor with a BooleanSupplier parameter
427     * @throws InvocationTargetException Couldn't invoke the constructor for other reasons
428     */
429    public U axisInstance(DoubleSupplier d)
430        throws InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, NoSuchMethodException, InvocationTargetException {
431        return axisClass.getConstructor(DoubleSupplier.class).newInstance(d);
432    }
433
434    // rumble stuff
435
436    /**
437     * Run a bunch of "RumbleBlips"
438     *
439     * @param blips The number of blips
440     */
441    public void rumbleBlips(int blips) {
442        gamepad.rumbleBlips(blips);
443    }
444
445    /**
446     * Run a single "RumbleBlip"
447     */
448    public void rumbleBlip() {
449        rumbleBlips(1);
450    }
451
452    /**
453     * Rumble the gamepad for 'seconds'
454     *
455     * @param seconds The number of (fractional) seconds to rumble for
456     */
457    public void rumble(double seconds) {
458        gamepad.rumble((int) (seconds * 1000));
459    }
460
461    /**
462     * Is the gamepad rumbling
463     *
464     * @return true if the gamepad is rumbling
465     */
466    public boolean isRumbling() {
467        return gamepad.isRumbling();
468    }
469
470    /**
471     * Stop rumbling on the gamepad
472     */
473    public void stopRumble() {
474        gamepad.stopRumble();
475    }
476
477    /**
478     * Rumble for about 1/8th of a second
479     */
480    public void rumble() {
481        rumble(120);
482    }
483
484    /**
485     * Enable/disable the gamepad (and all potentially bound commands!)
486     *
487     * @param enable True for enabled, false for disabled
488     * @return the Gamepad (for chaining)
489     */
490    @Override
491    public GamepadBase<T, U> setEnabled(boolean enable) {
492        enabled = enable;
493        for (Enablable<?> enablable : enablables) enablable.setEnabled(enable);
494        return this;
495    }
496
497    /**
498     * Is the gamepad (and all bound commands from it!) enabled?
499     *
500     * @return true if it's enabled, false if it's disabled
501     */
502    @Override
503    public boolean isEnabled() {
504        return enabled;
505    }
506}
